thread.title: Wednesday’s Travel News and Tips
thread.title_full: Wednesday’s Travel News and Tips - The New York Times

author: Shivani Vora
title: Wednesday’s Travel News and Tips
text:
Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.
IN CALIFORNIA, BACH BY THE SEA
From July 18 to Aug. 1, Carmel-by-the-Sea in California will host the 78th annual Carmel Bach Festival , focusing on the composer Johann Sebastian Bach and the musicians he influenced, such as Handel and Mozart. The lineup of 45 performances held in different venues in the town starts off with an opening night concert at the Sunset Center Theater where the festival’s orchestra, made up of musicians from around the world, will play works by Bach, Handel and Haydn. On July 21 there will be an afternoon concert at the All Saints Church during which notable oboe, clarinet and horn players from the United States plan to perform pieces by Schubert and Mozart including excerpts from his “Don Giovanni.” Prices from $10.
AN ART WEEKEND FROM BROWN’S HOTEL IN LONDON
